Car
Class RiskView

java.lang.Object
  javax.microedition.lcdui.Item
      javax.microedition.lcdui.CustomItem
          Car.RiskView

public class RiskView
extends javax.microedition.lcdui.CustomItem

the class diplay risk view which include the three risk factors. Which are: 1. speed 2.calls 3.key interactions.

Author:
Suha

(package private)  java.lang.String Str1
          user risk status sentence which include: 1."So boring you're#safe !!!" 2."You passed the school#bus driver test" 3."You drive alive#" 4."Not too safe and#not too risky" 5."Menace to society#" 6."Don't drive in#my neighborhood" 7."Ticking bomb#" if the sentence is long Str1 hold the part before '#'

Constructor Detail

RiskView

public RiskView(java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String p1,
                int s1,
                int s2,
                int s3,
                int s4,
                int s5,
                int s6)
initialize the class variables.

Parameters:
title - represents the date, it has the following formate day(number)/month(letters)/year(number).
p1 - user risk status sentence.
s1 - represents the total risk value.
s2 - represents the speed risk value.
s3 - represents the number of key interactions risk value.
s4 - represents the key interactions durations risk value.
s5 - represents number of calls risk value.
s6 - represents the call durations risk value.

drawRiskSquares

void drawRiskSquares(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                     int h,
                     int c,
                     int size,
                     int mrg)
draw squares and depending on the risk factor value the squares will be colored.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics object to be used for rendering the item
h - the height where we draw the squeres
c - specifiy the color of the squer that represent the risk
size - the square size.
mrg - margin in the x a
